title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: NotebookLM’s Video Overviews feature now supports 80 languages
items.description: NotebookLM’s Video Overviews now supports 80 languages, including French and Spanish.

items.title: Google will require developer verification for Android apps outside the Play Store
items.description: Google will ask all Android developers to verify their identity starting next year.

items.title: Elon Musk’s xAI Sues Apple and OpenAI Over App Store Rankings
items.description: The xAI lawsuit claims that Grok’s ranking below ChatGPT is a sign of allegedly monopolistic behavior.

items.title: Elon Musk’s xAI sues Apple and OpenAI, alleging anticompetitive collusion
items.description: According to Musk, Apple and OpenAI are colluding to stifle competition from other AI companies.

items.title: Best Discounts for Teachers (2025): Deals on School Supplies, Tech, and More
items.description: Ace the school year with special perks—like cheap software, phone plans, and classroom supplies.

items.title: 16 Best Back-to-School Deals for 2025
items.description: This WIRED-approved gear is on sale for the new school year. Save on tablets, headphones, desk chairs, and more.

items.title: Take 20 Percent Off Ooni’s Largest Pizza Oven for Labor Day
items.description: The Ooni Koda 2 Max is the best large pizza oven we have tested, and it’s now just over $1,000.

items.title: Bounce launches a service for moving accounts between Bluesky and Mastodon
items.description: Bounce publicly debuts a tool that will let you move your account between open social networks like Bluesky and Mastodon.

items.title: The 38 Best Deals From REI’s 2025 Labor Day Sale
items.description: Shop the best deals on WIRED-tested outdoor gear from REI, Nemo, MSR, Coleman, Fjällräven, and more during REI’s Labor Day sale.

items.title: A new security flaw in TheTruthSpy phone spyware is putting victims at risk
items.description: Exclusive: Hackers can take over the accounts of TheTruthSpy spyware customers, putting their victims' private phone data at risk thanks to a new secu...
